text: RT @KamalaHarris My advice to Black girls everywhere: whenever you find yourself in a room where there aren't a lot of people who look like you — be it a classroom, or a boardroom, or a courtroom — remember that you have an entire community in that room with you, all of us cheering you on.

On this day in 1870, the Fifteenth Amendment was ratified, granting Black men the right to vote. This was not fully realized for almost a century, and even today, we must work to reduce barriers to the ballot box and end voter suppression for communities of color.
RT @NYMag Paul Ryan deleted a tweet Saturday afternoon that advertised a woman’s $1.50-a-week raise as an impressive result of the GOP tax cut https://trib.al/SNLUEmL

RT @USATODAY After being mocked for bragging about the impact of a $1.50 increase in weekly pay, House Speaker Paul Ryan deleted his tweet. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2018/02/03/house-speaker-paul-ryans-costco-tax-cut-tweet-draws-taunts/303827002/

Madam C.J. Walker became the first American woman self-made millionaire after creating a line of hair care products for Black women who were experiencing the same scalp condition she had. She later opened a factory and beauty school in 1908, employing several thousand women. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DVKAGhhU8AAUh4L.jpg
